items.text: Quiet the mind, and the soul will speak.
items.author: Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati

items.text: Learn to be calm and you will always be happy.
items.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

items.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
items.author: Buddha

items.text: Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
items.author: James Allen

items.text: Whatever is fluid, soft, and yielding will overcome whatever is rigid and hard. What is soft is strong.
items.author: Lao Tzu

items.text: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a candle in a windless place.
items.author: Bhagavad Gita

items.text: When you own your breath, nobody can steal your peace.
items.author: Unknown

items.text: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
items.author: Marcus Aurelius

items.text: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges. So relax.
items.author: Bryant McGill

items.text: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
items.author: Lao Tzu

items.text: Meditation is not evasion; it is a serene encounter with reality.
items.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

items.text: The best meditation is effortless. The best meditation is a gentle awareness.
items.author: Maxime Lagac√©

items.text: Learn to slow down. Get lost intentionally. Observe how you judge both yourself and those around you.
items.author: Tim Ferriss

items.text: Suffering is due to our disconnection with the inner soul. Meditation is establishing that connection.
items.author: Amit Ray
